*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to J. B. Bailey, August 17, 1825. Concerning horse trading.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Spaniard Escovedo */person_mentioned*who says he owes you two horses has stored up his things at my *location_mentioned*house*/location_mentioned*, and in order that you may have no fears that he will leave here without paying you for the horses he has requested me to say to you that if you will send me his obligation he will pay it before his goods are taken away, and I will not allow him to move them untill it is paid— he has sent for the balance of his things*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="08-17-1825">Augt 17. 1825*/date_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr J. B. Baily*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
